thread.title: City Colder Than Shimla As Mercury Touches 4.7°c | Chandigarh News - Times of India
thread.title_full: City Colder Than Shimla As Mercury Touches 4.7°c | Chandigarh News - Times of India

author: TNN
title: City Colder Than Shimla As Mercury Touches 4.7°c | Chandigarh News - Times of India
text: Chandigarh: Chandigarh experienced a chillier night than Shimla, with temperatures dropping significantly.While Shimla registered 5°C as its minimum temperature, Chandigarh recorded 4.7°C, marking the season's lowest reading. This temperature stands five degrees below the normal range.This December night has proven to be colder compared to the previous year, when the lowest temperature in December 2023 was 6°C, observed on December 16 and 21.Following yesterday's minimum of 6°C, the city is experiencing its third successive cold wave. The meteorological department predicts these conditions to persist at least until December 13.The forecast indicates night temperatures will likely remain between 4°C-5°C for the upcoming five days, suggesting a prolonged cold spell.The daytime temperature in Chandigarh reached 21.6°C, which is typical for this period. In contrast, Shimla recorded a cooler daytime temperature of 14.4°C. Chandigarh's maximum temperature is expected to fluctuate between 23°C-24°C over the next five days.We also published the following articles recentlyKolkata's minimum temperature at 15.7C, season's lowestKolkata experienced its coldest day of the season so far, with the minimum temperature dipping to 15.7C. A western disturbance over north India is predicted to bring clouds to nearby regions, potentially raising Kolkata's minimum temperature to 16C on Monday.116121072Kandhamals G Udayagiri records lowest temperature in stateA cold wave has swept across Kandhamal district in Odisha, India, plunging temperatures to a state low of 9.2C in G Udayagiri. Dense fog has disrupted visibility and travel, forcing residents to seek warmth by bonfires. The freezing temperatures and fog have particularly impacted the tribal population's ability to gather forest produce.116256383Delhi receives light rain, temperature to decrease after December 9Delhi experienced light rain on Sunday evening due to a western disturbance. The India Meteorological Department (IMD) forecasts light to isolated rainfall in Punjab, Haryana, and Delhi-NCR over the next two days.116109895
